headline.main: Public Workers' Union Accepts Concessions and Averts Layoffs

docs.abstract: The Public Employees Federation, the state's second-largest union of public workers, has agreed to accept a revised package of wage and benefits concessions sought by the Cuomo administration, saving thousands of union members from layoffs.
docs.snippet: The Public Employees Federation, the state's second-largest union of public workers, has agreed to accept a revised package of wage and benefits concessions sought by the Cuomo administration, saving thousands of union members from layoffs.

docs.lead_paragraph: LATHAM, N.Y. - The state's second-largest union of public workers has agreed to accept a revised package of wage and benefits concessions sought by the Cuomo administration, saving thousands of union members from layoffs that would have begun Friday if the deal had been rejected.

docs.abstract: These conservative and liberal plans for cutting health care spending are dead ends.
docs.snippet: These conservative and liberal plans for cutting health care spending are dead ends.

docs.lead_paragraph: Everyone - conservative and liberal - agrees that $2.6 trillion a year is too much to spend on health care, and that we have to cut costs. But they don't agree on who is to blame or what is to be done.

headline.main: A Site for Data Scientists to Prove Their Skills and Make Money

docs.abstract: Kaggle connects data scientists with organizations that need someone to extract meaning from their data, like insurance companies that want to know the likelihood that a patient will be hospitalized.
docs.snippet: Kaggle connects data scientists with organizations that need someone to extract meaning from their data, like insurance companies that want to know the likelihood that a patient will be hospitalized.

docs.lead_paragraph: Airlines, insurance companies, hospitals and many other organizations are trying to figure out how to corral all their data and turn it into something useful.

docs.lead_paragraph: Financial conflicts have surfaced among members of three groups that are developing major public health standards on hypertension, cholesterol and obesity.

headline.seo: Potential Conflicts on U.S. Health Guideline Panels
headline.main: Health Guideline Panels Struggle with Conflicts of Interest

docs.abstract: Financial conflicts have surfaced among members of three groups that are developing major public health standards on hypertension, cholesterol and obesity; about 20 members have been advised that they should not vote on crucial topics as they prepare to issue guidelines, because they are too closely connected to drug industry and others with keen interest in panels' recommendations.
docs.snippet: Financial conflicts have surfaced among members of three groups that are developing major public health standards on hypertension, cholesterol and obesity.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ryan Perrilloux, a quarterback, has been on and off the team’s practice squad numerous times already this season.

headline.seo: For Giants’ Ryan Perrilloux, a Rollercoaster Life on the Practice Squad

docs.abstract: Profile of New York Giants on-again, off-again quarterback Ryan Perrilloux, who has been waived or had his contract terminated by the team five times in the past two months, including being cut on Nov 2.
docs.snippet: Ryan Perrilloux, a quarterback, has been on and off the team’s practice squad numerous times already this season.

docs.lead_paragraph: Four experts on fiscal policy — two Democrats and two Republicans — told the Joint Select Committee on Deficit Reduction that Congress should adopt spending cuts and increase tax revenues.

headline.seo: Deficit Reduction Panel Warned That It Must Not Fail
headline.main: Deficit Panel Is Warned That It Must Not Fail and Is Urged to Compromise
headline.print_headline: Deficit Panel Is Warned That It Must Not Fail and Is Urged to Compromise

docs.abstract: Four experts on fiscal policy, two Democrats and two Republicans, tell the Joint Select Committee on Deficit Reduction that Congress should reduce the budget deficit by adopting spending cuts and increasing tax revenues; Pete V Domenici, Alice M Rivlin, Alan K Simpson and Erskine B Bowles all urge Congress to devise a 'grand bargain' involving tax and entitlement changes to reduce deficits by $4 trillion over 10 years.
docs.snippet: Four experts on fiscal policy — two Democrats and two Republicans — told the Joint Select Committee on Deficit Reduction that Congress should adopt spending cuts and increase tax revenues.
